Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 about existing datasets for Question Answering (QA

title: The Stanford Question Answering Dataset" (SQuAD) - This dataset consists of questions and answers for a large set of Wikipedia articles, providing a challenging benchmark for QA systems
The QuASAR Dataset" - A dataset for question answering over scientific articles, containing questions and answers for a set of scientific articles

The Multi-Genre Natural Language Inference (MultiNLI) Dataset" - A dataset for natural language inference, containing pairs of sentences and their corresponding labels indicating whether the second sentence follows or contradicts the first
The ConceptNet 5.0 Dataset" - A dataset containing a large collection of concepts and their relationships, providing a rich source of commonsense knowledge for NLI and other tasks
The Quora Question Pairs Dataset" - A dataset of questions and answers from the Quora platform, providing a large set of questions and answers for training and evaluation
The NewsQA Dataset" - A dataset of news articles and questions, containing a large set of questions and answers for training and evaluation
The TriviaQA Dataset" - A dataset of trivia questions and answers, containing a large set of questions and answers for training and evaluation
The SQuAD 2.0 Dataset" - A dataset of questions and answers for a large set of Wikipedia articles, with improved quality and additional features compared to the original SQuAD dataset
